page.title: 11Housing
page.content: Housing in this area is extremly varied.The majority of houses/cottages are over 100 yrs old having once belonged to large farms and estates.The cottages have since been sold and renovated by their inhabitants. The houses are all individual in size,shape and charecter.Many cottages are made of local stone and 80% are half timbered framed dwellings otherwise known as "Black and White" houses providing a unique and picturesque area.These houses were built between the 16th and 17th century and as early as 1319. The recently built dwellings tend to be bungalows owned by the occupants. There is one planned estate consisting of 10 houses on the outskirts of Pembridge village. There are very few council houses in this area,some cottages are rented out
